name: 李宜桓
objective: In this course, we will systematically introduce various analysis techniques including UV-vis spectroscopy, photoluminescence spectroscopy, fourier-transform infrared spectroscopy, nuclear magnetic resonance, mass spectrometer, thermal analyses, optical microscopy, electron microscopy and atomic force microscopy. Students who study this course can establish a theoretical framework for the analysis of various organic materials, which will help their future research and employment development.
schedule:
1. (1st week)  Introduction 
2. (2nd and 3rd weeks)  UV & VIS 
3. (4th and 5th weeks)  PL 
4. (6th and 7th weeks)  IR 
5. (8th week)  Raman

(9th week)  Mid-term Exam 

7. (10th and 11th weeks)  Thermal Analyses 
8. (12th and 13th weeks)  Electron Microscopy 
9. (14th and 15th weeks)  Mass 
10. (16th and 17th weeks)  NMR 

(18th week)  Final Exam
scorePolicy:
Midterm exam 30%
Final exam 40%
Attendance and homework 30%
materials:
1. Principles of Instrumental Analysis (D.A. Skoog, 7th. ed.)
2. Gregory Timp, 1998, Nanotechnology, Spring-Verlag, New York, Inc
3. Sergei N. Magonov, Myung-Hwan Whanbo, Surface Analysis with STM and AFM, New York, Inc
